title.narrative: By 2025, the Mexican State plans with territorial, population and gender perspective, inclusive strategies to generate shared prosperity that reduces inequality and poverty.

description.narrative: Key stakeholders in Mexico produce and use gender-sensitive statistics so that more institutions have capacity to design, implement, monitor, and evaluate evidence-based policies with a local approach and with a gender perspective, to promote substantive equality and women participation in all sphere and for the follow-up of the 2030 agenda with gender perspective.

title.narrative: SN_DRF

National Statistics Offices drive analysis, research and innovation on gender statistics through the exchange of best practices at global, regional and national level to track progress of gender equality and women’s empowerment.

Number of knowledge products and tools to disseminate or exchange best practices in gender-sensitive statistics and in gender-sensitive geospatial analysis produced by national, regional and global institutions in partnership with UNW.

Number of knowledge products and tools to disseminate or exchange best practices in gender-sensitive statistics and in gender-sensitive geospatial analysis produced by national institutions in partnership with UNW.

National institutions strengthen their technical capacities to produce and use gender-sensitive statistics and design, implement, monitor and evaluate gender-responsive budgets and public policies for GEWE to advance the 2030 Agenda.

Federal and local stakeholders strengthen their capacities to guarantee women´s social, public and political participation, based on the parity principle, to influence decision-making in all areas, supported on data and evidence.
